724851f-a.text:
York Avenue (name changed 1928 from Avenue A), east side, north from and including 6lst Street. On the N.E. corner of 62nd Street is the pumping station of the Consolidated Gas Company, and behind it may be seen the old American Malting Company plant, on 64th Street east of the Avenue. It now belongs to George Ehret, and will be demolished three years from the time of this picture. Above 64th Street may be seen trees on the grounds of the Rockefeller Institute for Medical Research.
September 15, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

724852f-a.text:
(1)
York Avenue west side Gas Holder stations located between East 61st and 63rd Streets looking southwards When northwest corner marked site of the Flower Hospital.
(2)
York Avenue, east side at east 6lst Street, looking northwards showing Gas Holder on west side and East River on east side of buildings.
(3)
Same. Different angle.
P.L.Speer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.  September 29, 1940.
